references.reason: This paper is a technical report of GPT-4, a large language model that underpins the CARE system's functionality and capabilities.
This foundational paper demonstrates that large language models can effectively perform tasks beyond their training data, impacting the CARE system's approach to exploratory tasks.

references.paper_title: Training language models to follow instructions with human feedback
references.reason: This paper introduces a method for training LLMs to follow instructions effectively, which is relevant to the CARE system's reliance on fine-tuned LLMs for various tasks.

references.paper_title: AI Chains: Transparent and Controllable Human-AI Interaction by Chaining Large Language Model Prompts
references.reason: This work explores transparent and controllable human-AI interaction using chained LLMs, informing the multi-agent architecture design of the CARE system.

references.paper_title: Beyond ChatBots: ExploreLLM for Structured Thoughts and Personalized Model Responses
references.reason: This paper introduces ExploreLLM, a system that uses LLMs for structured thought and personalized responses, influencing the CARE system's interface and interactive solution generation.
